locale.array: Début des saignements,La ona pendant laquelle le saignement a été vu,#flow-s
Période des règles,Le minimum de jours du règles à compter du début des règles,#flow-in
Hefsek tahara,La bedika 'Mokh dakhuk' à la fin des règles,#hefsek
7 nekiim,Sept jours pendant lesquels on vérifie deux fois par jours l'absence du sang,#7-nekim
Mikve,Le mikvéà la fin des 7 nekiim,#mikveh
Veset hahodech,'Ona' pendant laquelle il est possible de voir le début des règles en raison du jour du mois hébraïque,#veset-hodesh
Veset haflaga,'Ona' pendant laquelle il est possible de voir le début des règles en raison de la distance entre le hefsek tahara et le début des rèles,#veset-haflaga
Ona benonit,Jour entier correspondant à un cycle présent chez la plupart des femmes,#ona-benonit
locale.string: You may have a Fixed Cycle!
A Fixed cycle (veses kavuah) has been established by three flows all having haflagah number

Please have a rabbi review your calendar in order to confirm this and instruct you how to keep a calendar with a *B*fixed*/B* cycle. You should inform the rabbi if you have given birth in the past 24 months. If the rabbi confirms that you do have a fixed cycle then your online calendar will no longer calculate your onot of anticipation correctly until you have completely uprooted the fixed cycle.
You may not enter future dates, please either enter a valid jewish or secular date
You are attempting to add a New Flow without confirming that a Hefsek Taharah has been done for a flow start on the
. Please close this box and confirm the date of your Hefesk Taharah before adding a new flow.

If this is not an error and you are doing this on the advice and permission of your Orthodox rabbi, please email us or call our toll free number (1-866-908-2468) for detailed instructions on how to enter this information into the calendar and allow the program to function accordingly.

*H1* Please read the following carefully */H1* You have entered an Unclean Bedikah during your Seven Preparatory days (after completing your Hefsek Taharah) on a date that is *B*after*/B* seven days from the onset of your period . There is a difference of halachic opionion on how the calendar should be kept.*BR* Some Rabbanim maintain the opinion that an unclean bedikah occuring at this time is considered a New Flow. New calculations must then be made on the calendar. If you follow this opinion, please select "Start of menstrual cycle" from the drop down list of causes and the program will calculate accordingly. *BR* Other Rabbanim maintain the opinion that only an actual New Flow during this time requires new calculations. If you follow this opinion, please choose "Stain found on white garment or body" from the drop down list of causes and the program will calculate accordingly. *BR* Please consult your rabbi to determine which opinion he wishes you to follow.

*H1*New flow after large gap */H1* You have entered a New Flow that is 90 days or more from your last flow. If you are in the menopausal years you are not required to keep the Onot Haveset until you have three New Flows. Once you have had three New Flows, the laws of Onot Haveset must again be kept. If you are not in the menopausal years please consult a qualified rabbi to determine how your calendar should be kept.*BR* Please note that it is recommended that a woman during the menopausal years, who is uncertain when her next New Flow will be, do a bedikah prior to intimacy until six months have passed with no cycle.
